data.description:
This interactive and manipulative simulation invites participants to explore and practice the steps involved with proper hygiene and hand washing in a fun and engaging format. Based on information from the CDC, the simulation walks the participant through a background primer and then asks the participant to engage in a sort-and-match activity which reinforces vital components in the handwashing process. Next, the participant explores two familiar environments, a private or home-based setting and a public or work-based setting to put into practice what they learned. Participants can revisit any part of the simulation as needed. 

Special attention is paid to diversity, inclusivity, and ability, including offering participants the option of perspective, either standing or sitting. 
The simulation employs learning objectives based on Bloom's revised taxonomy, including remembering, understanding, and applying. It also includes gamification elements built into the activity designed to engage and challenge participants.

Participant Primer Info and Activity
•Background Information
•Outline of key steps involved
•Participant engagement activity with feedback (sort-and-match)

Participant Simulations
•Private or home setting
•Public or work setting
